awd_titl_txt: Partial Core Support on the Board of Physics and Astronomy
awd_abstract_narration:
This award provides partial core support to the Board on Physics and Astronomy (BPA).  The physics and astronomy communities cover a broad and diverse set of research effort. The BPA  monitors developments in and assesses the health of the fields that make up this area of research.  Its membership is drawn from universities, industry, and national laboratories, and its members' areas of expertise span much of the breadth of physics and astronomy. The experts involved are broadly representative of the community and they provide their informed perspectives on issues that affect the progress and vitality of physics and astronomy research. 

The principal work to be supported by this award will be to support the board's semi-annual meetings and non-sponsored other activities associated with the board's carrying out its responsibilities to support the physics and astronomy research communities.  A principal focus of the BPA in the period covered by this award will be the development and initiation of the next round of physics and astronomy/astrophysics decadal surveys.  This award is co-funded by the Divisions of Physics, Astronomical Sciences, and Materials Research, as well as the Office of Multidisciplinary Activities, all within the Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences.

Project Outcomes Report

National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine

Board on Physics and Astronomy

 

This grant provided partial support for the National Academies? Board on Physics and Astronomy (BPA).  The BPA is the National Academies? principal forum for issues connected with the fields of physics and astronomy.  Its overall objectives are to identify important new developments at the scientific forefronts in these fields, to foster interactions with other fields, to strengthen connections to technology, and to facilitate effective service to the nation by the physics and astronomy scientific community.  Much of its efforts are carried out through the activities of ad hoc study committees that produce reports providing guidance to federal agencies. Members of these committees are selected for their expertise and many are considered the nation's most eminent scholars.  Further, their selection is made in such a manner to assure the highest degree of independence and objectivity.  Among the recent reports issued under the auspices of the BPA are a study that assesses the opportunities and possible paths forward for investing in high-intensity lasers and a study that provides a strategic plan for U.S. fusion research.  Pdf versions of these report are available for download, for free, at https://www.nap.edu/catalog/24939/opportunities-in-intense-ultrafast-lasers-reaching-for-the-brightest-light and https://www.nap.edu/catalog/25331/final-report-of-the-committee-on-a-strategic-plan-for-us-burning-plasma-research.
